name: Oil-free Chocolate Cake
description: This cake is made with cooked sweet potato, non-dairy yogurt and whole wheat flour. The perfect cake if you are looking for a lighter option.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup coconut sugar, or regular sugar
3/4 cup cooked and peeled sweet potato, see notes
1/2 cup non-dairy yogurt, plain or vanilla

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray a 9 inch cake pan with oil, using as little as possible. You can also cut a circle of parchment paper to fit the bottom of the pan. This will make it easier to pop the cake out when it's done.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray a 9 inch cake pan with oil, using as little as possible. You can also cut a circle of parchment paper to fit the bottom of the pan. This will make it easier to pop the cake out when it's done.

recipeInstructions.text: Add all dry ingredients, including chocolate chips, in a large bowl and stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add all dry ingredients, including chocolate chips, in a large bowl and stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, add the cooked and cooled sweet potato, almond milk, apple cider vinegar and pure vanilla extract. Blend until very smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: In a blender, add the cooked and cooled sweet potato, almond milk, apple cider vinegar and pure vanilla extract. Blend until very smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the blended mixture to the dry ingredients, and also dump in the non-dairy yogurt. Stir with a wooden spoon until just combined, being careful not to over mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the blended mixture to the dry ingredients, and also dump in the non-dairy yogurt. Stir with a wooden spoon until just combined, being careful not to over mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cake batter to the pan, spreading it evenly with a spatula.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cake batter to the pan, spreading it evenly with a spatula.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 25-30 minutes, until a toothpick comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 25-30 minutes, until a toothpick comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Let cool completely before frosting (recipe below.)
recipeInstructions.name: Let cool completely before frosting (recipe below.)
